title: Home
text:
I am a FinTech and Applied Computing student at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) with a strong interest in AI, finance, and software engineering.
I enjoy building:

Trading algorithms

Data dashboards

AI-powered tools

This website showcases my experience, projects, and reflections.

title: Home
text:
This is my Quarto website.
This page is written in Quarto Markdown.
You can edit this file to change what appears on the homepage.

title: About
text:
This website was built using Quarto and RStudio.
You can use Quarto to build: - Websites - Reports - Blogs - Dashboards

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text: I used ChatGPT to help me: - Structure my Quarto website - Write clean Markdown - Organize my portfolio pages

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text: I used ChatGPT to help me: - Structure my Quarto website - Write clean Markdown - Organize my portfolio pages

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
Benefits
GenAI helped me quickly: - Convert ideas into formatted web pages - Debug Quarto and GitHub issues - Improve clarity of writing

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
Challenges
Sometimes the output needed: - Verification - Adjustments for technical accuracy

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
Future use
I will continue using GenAI for: - Coding - Data analysis - Technical writing - System design

title: Projects
text:
This project is a web-based stock analysis platform that I built to help investors make data-driven decisions.
It includes: - Real-time stock prices - Technical indicators such as RSI, MACD, and Bollinger Bands - Portfolio risk analysis and return tracking - AI-generated summaries of stock performance
The system processes numerical financial data and visualizes it using interactive charts, allowing users to quickly understand market trends and portfolio performance.
Visit my stock website

title: Projects
text:
üéÆ Preschool Educational Game

This is an educational game for preschool children designed to improve: - Pattern recognition
- Memory
- Basic problem solving
The game includes: - Interactive graphics - Sound feedback - Progress tracking
The goal is to make early learning more engaging through gamification and simple UI design.

title: Projects
section: üß† Facial Recognition using OpenCV & Machine Learning
text:
üß† Facial Recognition using OpenCV & Machine Learning

This project demonstrates a machine learning‚Äìbased facial recognition system built using Python and OpenCV.
The system: - Detects human faces in real time - Extracts facial features - Trains a model to recognize known individuals - Performs live identity prediction through a webcam
This project showcases: - Computer vision - Machine learning - Real-time image processing
It is an example of how AI can be used for security, authentication, and human‚Äìcomputer interaction.

title: Projects
text:
üìä Live Stock Data Visualization
This visualization uses historical stock price data exported from my Supabase database.

AAPL


stocks <- read.csv(‚Äúdata/stock_prices.csv‚Äù) stocks\(date <- as.Date(stocks\)date)
aapl <- stocks[stocks$ticker == ‚ÄúAAPL‚Äù, ]
plot( aapl\(date,
  aapl\)close, type = ‚Äúl‚Äù, col = ‚Äú#2563eb‚Äù, lwd = 2, xlab = ‚ÄúDate‚Äù, ylab = ‚ÄúClosing Price‚Äù, main = ‚ÄúAAPL Closing Price‚Äù )
